tool.name: GDBToXLS

param.name: gdb_path
param.dialogReference: The geodatabase from which the schema will be exported.
param.pythonReference: Full path to the geodatabase from which the schema will be exported.

param.name: output_directory
param.dialogReference: The folder where the 3 Excel spreadsheets will be output.
param.pythonReference: The full path to the folder where the 3 Excel spreadsheets will be output.

param.name: include_all_field_in_subtypes
param.dialogReference: When writing out the subtype details table, the default is to only include fields that have been modified in the subtype (domain or default set). Checking this option will include all fields regardless of whether they are modified.
param.pythonReference: When writing out the subtype details table, the default is to only include fields that have been modified in the subtype (domain or default set). Setting this option to true will include all fields regardless of whether they are modified.

param.name: hide_template
param.dialogReference: By default, the workbook will include a template sheet from which one can create new datasets and domains. Checking this option will hide that template sheet.
param.pythonReference: By default, the workbook will include a template sheet from which one can create new datasets and domains. Setting this option to true will hide that template sheet.

tool.summary: Read the schema of a geodatabase, outputting 3 Excel spreadsheets detailing the datasets (table, and feature classes), domains, and relationship classes. Fields and subtypes will be included where necessary.

scriptExample.title: Calling this tool in Python
scriptExample.code: arcpy.ImportToolbox(r"C:\Files\gdbschematools\Geodatabase Schema Tools.pyt") arcpy.GeodatabaseSchemaTools.GDBToXLS( gdb_path=r"C:\Files\my_geodatabase.gdb", output_directory=r"C:\Files\GDB_Output", include_all_field_in_subtypes=False, hide_template=True )
